original: shes rab kyis rig pa'i gnas lnga la shin tu mkhas pas dbang che bar grags pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyis rig pa'i gnas lnga la shin tu mkhas pas dbang che bar grags pa'o //
translated: By means of their wisdom, they become very learned in the five sciences and thus become famous.

original: mtshams rnam par grol ba'i mdo las /
analyzed: mtshams rnam par grol ba'i mdo las /
translated: The Sutra of the Liberation of Maitreya states:

original: longs spyod chen po dang / bde 'gror 'gro ba dang / kho na med pa gsum ni mdo 'di las gsungs pa dang mthun no //
analyzed: longs spyod chen po dang / bde 'gror 'gro ba dang / kho na med pa gsum ni mdo 'di las gsungs pa dang mthun no //
translated: The three qualities of great resources, going to happy rebirths and being without enemies are consistent with this sutra.

original: bzhi pa ni 'phel ba med pa'o //
analyzed: bzhi pa ni 'phel ba med pa'o //
translated: The fourth is the absence of increase.

original: lnga pa ni bde ba mang zhing sems can gyi bdag po byed pa'o //
analyzed: lnga pa ni bde ba mang zhing sems can gyi bdag po byed pa'o //
translated: The fifth is having much happiness and becoming a lord of sentient beings.

original: drug pa ni rang gi lus la gnod pa byed pa med cing las su rung ba chen po dang ldan pa'o zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: drug pa ni rang gi lus la gnod pa byed pa med cing las su rung ba chen po dang ldan pa'o zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: The sixth is being free of harm to one's body and having great flexibility.

original: dgongs pa zab mo rnam par dgrol ba'i mdo las ni bsod nams can gyi longs spyod thob pa'i phyir dang / bde 'gror 'gro ba'i phyir dang / khon med pa'i phyir dang / dbyen med cing bde ba med pa'i phyir dang / rtag par sems can gyi bdag po byed pa'i phyir bdag nyid kyi lus la gnod pa med pa'i phyir dang /
analyzed: dgongs pa zab mo rnam par dgrol ba'i mdo las ni bsod nams can gyi longs spyod thob pa'i phyir dang / bde 'gror 'gro ba'i phyir dang / khon med pa'i phyir dang / dbyen med cing bde ba med pa'i phyir dang / rtag par sems can gyi bdag po byed pa'i phyir bdag nyid kyi lus la gnod pa med pa'i phyir dang /
translated: because they are free of disharmony and disputes,üîΩbecause they are always the lord of sentient beings,

original: mthu chen po'i phyir ro zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: mthu chen po'i phyir ro zhes 'byung ste /
translated: and because they have great power.

original: @52a * // mtshams rnam par dgrol ba'i mdo las ni go rims nor ba dang / dgongs pa zab mo rnam par dgrol ba'i mdo las 'bras bu bdun bstan pa dang / mi gsal bar 'gyur ba ni lo ts'a ba dag gi bsam pa tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: @52a * // mtshams rnam par dgrol ba'i mdo las ni go rims nor ba dang / dgongs pa zab mo rnam par dgrol ba'i mdo las 'bras bu bdun bstan pa dang / mi gsal bar 'gyur ba ni lo ts'a ba dag gi bsam pa tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The Sutra on the Full Understanding of the Scope of the Bodhisattvas states that the results are seven, but in reverse order.

original: bstan bcos chos mngon pa sna tshogs kun las btus pa las ni pha rol tu phyin pa drug po dag so so nas 'bras bu lnga lnga thob par ston to //
analyzed: bstan bcos chos mngon pa sna tshogs kun las btus pa las ni pha rol tu phyin pa drug po dag so so nas 'bras bu lnga lnga thob par ston to //
translated: The treatise Compendium of Abhidharma teaches that each of the six perfections has five results.

original: mdo 'di las ni 'bras bu re re thob par bstan te /
analyzed: mdo 'di las ni 'bras bu re re thob par bstan te /
translated: This sutra teaches that each result is obtained.

original: de'i phyir bstan bcos la phan yon ni rnam pa lnga'i skabs su dpag tu med pa'i bsngags pa brjod pa gang yin pa de ni phan yon zhes bya'o //üîΩ'di lta ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir bstan bcos la phan yon ni rnam pa lnga'i skabs su dpag tu med pa'i bsngags pa brjod pa gang yin pa de ni phan yon zhes bya'o // 'di lta ste /
translated: Therefore, the benefit of the treatise is the praise of the immeasurable, which is the benefit.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa de dag gi mi mthun pa'i phyogs spangs pa ni bral ba'i 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa de dag gi mi mthun pa'i phyogs spangs pa ni bral ba'i 'bras bu'o //
translated: The abandonment of the resistances to those perfections is the separation result.

original: mthong ba'i chos la sbyin pa la sogs pas bdag dang gzhan rjes su 'dzin pa ni skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: mthong ba'i chos la sbyin pa la sogs pas bdag dang gzhan rjes su 'dzin pa ni skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu'o //
translated: The support of self and other in this life through generosity and so forth is the result of conscious effort.

original: phyi ma la gong nas gong du khyad par du 'phags pa mchog dam pa 'byung ba ni rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: phyi ma la gong nas gong du khyad par du 'phags pa mchog dam pa 'byung ba ni rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu'o //
translated: The arising of the superior, the sublime, in the future is the natural result.

original: byang chub chen po thob par 'gyur ba ni dbang gi 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: byang chub chen po thob par 'gyur ba ni dbang gi 'bras bu'o //
translated: The attainment of great enlightenment is the sovereign result.

original: longs spyod chen po dang / bde 'gror 'gro ba dang / khon med pa dang / dbyen med pa dang / bde ba dang / yid bde ba mang ba dang / sems can la dbang ba dang / lus la gnod pa med pa dang / dbang che bar grags pa ni go rims bzhin du sbyin pa la sogs pa pha rol tu phyin pa'i rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bur rig par bya'o zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: longs spyod chen po dang / bde 'gror 'gro ba dang / khon med pa dang / dbyen med pa dang / bde ba dang / yid bde ba mang ba dang / sems can la dbang ba dang / lus la gnod pa med pa dang / dbang che bar grags pa ni go rims bzhin du sbyin pa la sogs pa pha rol tu phyin pa'i rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bur rig par bya'o zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: Great wealth, going to good rebirths, being without enemies, being without discord, having much happiness and mental pleasure, being powerful over sentient beings, having a body free from harm, and being renowned as powerful are the results of evolutionary development of the transcendences, generosity, etc., respectively.

original: gzhan yang bstan bcos rnam par rig pa tsam du grub pa las /
analyzed: gzhan yang bstan bcos rnam par rig pa tsam du grub pa las /
translated: Moreover, the treatise Establishing Sovereignty over All Ones Own Manifestations states:

original: zag pa dang bcas pa ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: zag pa dang bcas pa ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: The contaminated have four results,

original: bral ba'i 'bras bu ma gtogs pas so //
analyzed: bral ba'i 'bras bu ma gtogs pas so //
translated: excluding the result of separation.

original: zag pa med pa la yang rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: zag pa med pa la yang rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: The uncontaminated have four results,

original: rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu ma gtogs pas so ;
analyzed: rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu ma gtogs pas so ;
translated: excluding the result of evolutionary development.

original: / gang 'bras bu lnga tshang bar bstan pa de ni phan tshun gcig gis gcig la phan 'dogs pa 'am /
analyzed: / gang 'bras bu lnga tshang bar bstan pa de ni phan tshun gcig gis gcig la phan 'dogs pa 'am /
translated: The teaching that all five results are complete is based on the mutual assistance of the transcendences.

original: gnyi ga bsdus pa'i bstan pa yin no zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: gnyi ga bsdus pa'i bstan pa yin no zhes 'byung ste /
translated: The teachings are included in both.

original: 'di ni bstan bcos chos mngon pa sna tshogs kun las btus pa las de dag brda sprod pa yin no /üîΩ// / bam po drug cu gcig pa /
analyzed: 'di ni bstan bcos chos mngon pa sna tshogs kun las btus pa las de dag brda sprod pa yin no / // / bam po drug cu gcig pa /
translated: This is the explanation of these terms in the treatise Compendium of Abhidharma.

original: bcom ldan 'das pha rol tu phyin pa dang 'dres pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa'i chos gang lags zhes bya ba 'di man chad ni gsum pa zhus pa dang / lan dag gis pha rol tu phyin pa dang 'dres pa'i chos rnam par 'byed pa ston to //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das pha rol tu phyin pa dang 'dres pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa'i chos gang lags zhes bya ba 'di man chad ni gsum pa zhus pa dang / lan dag gis pha rol tu phyin pa dang 'dres pa'i chos rnam par 'byed pa ston to //
translated: The third section is the explanation of the differentiation of the phenomena that are mixed with the perfections, with the third question and answer.

original: 'di yang zhu ba gsol ba dang / lan du gsungs pa bstan te /
analyzed: 'di yang zhu ba gsol ba dang / lan du gsungs pa bstan te /
translated: This is also taught with a request and a reply.

original: 'di ni @52b dang po gong du kha na ma tho ba med pa bstan pa'i skabs su kun nas nyon mongs pa dang ma 'dres pa zhes gsungs pa de zhu ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ni @52b dang po gong du kha na ma tho ba med pa bstan pa'i skabs su kun nas nyon mongs pa dang ma 'dres pa zhes gsungs pa de zhu ba'o //
translated: This is the request for the explanation of the phrase unmixed with afflictions that was mentioned above in the section on the absence of wrongdoing.

original: rigs kyi bu mdor bsdu na rnam pa bzhir rig par bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni gnyis pa de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag par lan du gsungs pa ston to //
analyzed: rigs kyi bu mdor bsdu na rnam pa bzhir rig par bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni gnyis pa de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag par lan du gsungs pa ston to //
translated: The second, the Tathagata's reply, is shown by Son of good family, in brief, it should be known as fourfold.

original: 'di yang rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: 'di yang rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: This is also threefold:

original: grangs smos nas lan mdor gsungs pa dang / rnam par phye ste bstan pa dang / gzhan dag gis rgol ba'i rjes su bzlas te bstan pa ste /
analyzed: grangs smos nas lan mdor gsungs pa dang / rnam par phye ste bstan pa dang / gzhan dag gis rgol ba'i rjes su bzlas te bstan pa ste /
translated: the brief reply after stating the number, the detailed explanation, and the explanation by repeating the opponent's statements.

original: 'di ni dang po grangs smos nas lan mdor gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni dang po grangs smos nas lan mdor gsungs pa'o //
translated: This is the first, the brief reply after stating the number.

original: snying rje med pa'i sbyor ba'i phyir dang / tshul bzhin ma yin pa'i sbyor ba'i phyir dang / rtag tu mi byed pa'i sbyor ba'i phyir dang / ma gus pa'i sbyor ba'i phyir dang zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa go rims bzhin du rnam par phye ste bstan pa'o //
analyzed: snying rje med pa'i sbyor ba'i phyir dang / tshul bzhin ma yin pa'i sbyor ba'i phyir dang / rtag tu mi byed pa'i sbyor ba'i phyir dang / ma gus pa'i sbyor ba'i phyir dang zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa go rims bzhin du rnam par phye ste bstan pa'o //
translated: The second, the detailed explanation, is as follows: Because of the application of lack of compassion, because of the application of incorrectness, because of the application of never doing, and because of the application of disrespect.

original: 'di ltar bsgom pa rnam pa bzhi la sgrib pa'i phyir rnam pa bzhi zhes gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar bsgom pa rnam pa bzhi la sgrib pa'i phyir rnam pa bzhi zhes gsungs pa yin te /
translated: Thus, it is called fourfold because it obscures the four types of cultivation.

original: de la bsgom pa rnam pa bzhi ni /
analyzed: de la bsgom pa rnam pa bzhi ni /
translated: The four kinds of meditation are as follows.üîΩüîΩ

original: mdzod kyi bstan bcos las ji skad du /
analyzed: mdzod kyi bstan bcos las ji skad du /
translated: The four kinds of meditation are mentioned in the Abhidharmako≈õa:

original: bsgom pa ni rnam pa bzhi yod de /
analyzed: bsgom pa ni rnam pa bzhi yod de /
translated: Meditation is of four kinds:

original: dang po lus pa med par bsgom pa ni bsod nams dang / ye shes rnam pa gnyis kyi tshogs lus pa med par bsgom pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dang po lus pa med par bsgom pa ni bsod nams dang / ye shes rnam pa gnyis kyi tshogs lus pa med par bsgom pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Meditation without remainder, because one meditates on the two stores of merit and wisdom without remainder.

original: gnyis pa yun ring por bsgom pa ni bskal pa chen po grangs med pa gsum du sgom par byed kyang ngal ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnyis pa yun ring por bsgom pa ni bskal pa chen po grangs med pa gsum du sgom par byed kyang ngal ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Meditation for a long time, because one meditates for three measureless kalpas without fatigue.

original: gsum pa rgyun chad pa med par bsgom pa ni nan tan brtson 'grus kyis skad cig gcig la bsgom zhing yongs su skyo ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gsum pa rgyun chad pa med par bsgom pa ni nan tan brtson 'grus kyis skad cig gcig la bsgom zhing yongs su skyo ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Meditation without interruption, because one meditates in a single instant with earnest effort without becoming weary.

original: bzhi pa gus par bsgom pa ni bslab par bya ba dag la gus pa dang / nga rgyal med pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa lta bu ste /
analyzed: bzhi pa gus par bsgom pa ni bslab par bya ba dag la gus pa dang / nga rgyal med pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa lta bu ste /
translated: Meditation with respect, because one is respectful and not proud with regard to what is to be learned.

original: bstan bcos rnam par bshad pa las kyang de skad du bshad do //
analyzed: bstan bcos rnam par bshad pa las kyang de skad du bshad do //
translated: This is explained in the Vyakhyayukti as well.

original: bstan bcos rnam par rig pa tsam du grub pa las ni /
analyzed: bstan bcos rnam par rig pa tsam du grub pa las ni /
translated: The treatise Establishing Knowledge Only explains:üîΩThere are five aspects of meditation.

original: bsgom pa rnam pa lnga zhes bshad de de'i phyir de nyid las /
analyzed: bsgom pa rnam pa lnga zhes bshad de de'i phyir de nyid las /
translated: Therefore, that treatise states:

original: dang po sems bskyed pa dang / yun ring po dang / rgyun chad pa med pa dang / gus pa med pa dang / lus pa med par bsgom pa'i phyir ro zhes 'byung ba yin te /
analyzed: dang po sems bskyed pa dang / yun ring po dang / rgyun chad pa med pa dang / gus pa med pa dang / lus pa med par bsgom pa'i phyir ro zhes 'byung ba yin te /
translated: Because of the first generation of the mind, long duration, uninterrupted meditation, lack of respect, and complete meditation.

original: rnam par bshad pa ni med do //
analyzed: rnam par bshad pa ni med do //
translated: There is no commentary.

original: 'dir ni dang po sems bskyed pa bkol ba'i phyir rnam pa bzhir gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dir ni dang po sems bskyed pa bkol ba'i phyir rnam pa bzhir gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Here, four aspects are stated because the first generation of the mind is applied.

original: de la snying rje med pa'i sbyor bas ni yun ring por bsgom pa la sgrib par byed de /
analyzed: de la snying rje med pa'i sbyor bas ni yun ring por bsgom pa la sgrib par byed de /
translated: Among them, the application of lack of compassion obstructs long duration meditation.

original: 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' rnams bskal ba chen po grangs med pa gsum du bsgrub par nus pa yang snying rje chen po'i stobs kyis yin gyi /
analyzed: 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' rnams bskal ba chen po grangs med pa gsum du bsgrub par nus pa yang snying rje chen po'i stobs kyis yin gyi /
translated: Thus, bodhisattvas are able to practice for three measureless great eons because of the power of great compassion.

original: @53a * // snying rje'i stobs med pa'i phyir yun ring po bas ni ma yin pas so //
analyzed: @53a * // snying rje'i stobs med pa'i phyir yun ring po bas ni ma yin pas so //
translated: It is not because of long duration without the power of compassion.

original: de la tshul bzhin ma yin pa'i sbyor bas ni lus med par bsgom pa la sgrib par byed do //
analyzed: de la tshul bzhin ma yin pa'i sbyor bas ni lus med par bsgom pa la sgrib par byed do //
translated: The practice of non-reflection obscures the cultivation of the non-existence of the body.

original: spyod pa gcig bsgrub pa'i tshe /
analyzed: spyod pa gcig bsgrub pa'i tshe /
translated: When one is engaged in the practice of one perfection,

original: pha rol tu phyin pa rnams kyi spyod pa khyad par bsgom mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa rnams kyi spyod pa khyad par bsgom mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: one is unable to cultivate the distinctive practice of the other perfections.üîΩThe practice of non-constancy obscures the cultivation of uninterrupted practice.

original: rtag tu mi byed pa'i sbyor bas ni rgyun chad pa med par bsgom pa la sgrib par byed de de la rtag tu zhes bya ba ni rgyun du bya ba la bya'o //
analyzed: rtag tu mi byed pa'i sbyor bas ni rgyun chad pa med par bsgom pa la sgrib par byed de de la rtag tu zhes bya ba ni rgyun du bya ba la bya'o //
translated: Here, constancy means constant practice.

original: 'di ltar le lo'i dbang gis rgyun chad pa med par rgyun du spyod pa rnams bsgrub par mi nus pas so //
analyzed: 'di ltar le lo'i dbang gis rgyun chad pa med par rgyun du spyod pa rnams bsgrub par mi nus pas so //
translated: Thus, due to the power of laziness, one is unable to accomplish constant practice without interruption.

original: ma gus pas ni gus par bsgom pa la sgrib par byed de /
analyzed: ma gus pas ni gus par bsgom pa la sgrib par byed de /
translated: Lack of respect obscures the cultivation of respectful practice.

original: 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' rnams pha rol tu phyin pa drug gi chos la spyod pa na spyod pa re re la gus pa bskyed nas sbyin pa la sogs pa spyod pas so //
analyzed: 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' rnams pha rol tu phyin pa drug gi chos la spyod pa na spyod pa re re la gus pa bskyed nas sbyin pa la sogs pa spyod pas so //
translated: Thus, when the bodhisattvas practice the Dharma of the six perfections, they generate respect for each practice and engage in generosity and so on.

original: rnam pa bzhi po 'di dag gis pha rol tu phyin pa spyod pa'i tshe 'dren mar 'byung bas 'dres pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rnam pa bzhi po 'di dag gis pha rol tu phyin pa spyod pa'i tshe 'dren mar 'byung bas 'dres pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: These four kinds are called the afflictions of confusion because they occur in confusion when one practices the transcendences.

original: de la tshul bzhin ma yin pa'i sbyor ba ni 'di lta ste /üîΩpha rol tu phyin pa gzhan bsgom pa'i tshe /
analyzed: de la tshul bzhin ma yin pa'i sbyor ba ni 'di lta ste / pha rol tu phyin pa gzhan bsgom pa'i tshe /
translated: Among them, the application of non-reflection is as follows:üîΩWhen one cultivates another of the transcendences, one abandons and diminishes the other transcendences.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa gzhan yongs su spong zhing nyams pa gang yin pa'o zhes bya ba ni gsum pa rgol ba'i rjes su bzlas te bstan pa ston to //üîΩ'di yang gang gi tshul bzhin ma yin pa zhes gsungs pas kyang nyes pa bsdus pa yin mod kyi /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa gzhan yongs su spong zhing nyams pa gang yin pa'o zhes bya ba ni gsum pa rgol ba'i rjes su bzlas te bstan pa ston to // 'di yang gang gi tshul bzhin ma yin pa zhes gsungs pas kyang nyes pa bsdus pa yin mod kyi /
translated: This is the third objection, which is repeated and explained.üîΩThis is also included in the error of non-reflection, as stated in the above passage.

original: yang dag pa'i rigs pa dang yang 'gal bas 'dir mdo 'di las rnal 'byor pas 'gal te /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i rigs pa dang yang 'gal bas 'dir mdo 'di las rnal 'byor pas 'gal te /
translated: But since it also contradicts right reason, it is refuted here in this scripture.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa gcig kho na las spyod par 'gyur na pha rol tu phyin pa gzhan rnams kyi spyod pa yongs su spong bar 'gyur bas tshul bzhin ma yin pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa gcig kho na las spyod par 'gyur na pha rol tu phyin pa gzhan rnams kyi spyod pa yongs su spong bar 'gyur bas tshul bzhin ma yin pa zhes bya ste /
translated: Therefore, it is called ‚Äúincorrect.‚Äù

original: de'i phyir dgongs pa zab mo rnam par dgrol ba'i mdo las ;
analyzed: de'i phyir dgongs pa zab mo rnam par dgrol ba'i mdo las ;
translated: Therefore, in the Sutra Unravelling the Intended Meaning,üîΩit says:

original: pha rol tu phyin pa rnams la spyod pa na gal te spyod pa gzhan dang bral bar gyur na tshul bzhin ma yin pa zhes bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa rnams la spyod pa na gal te spyod pa gzhan dang bral bar gyur na tshul bzhin ma yin pa zhes bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúWhen practicing the perfections, if you are separated from the other practices, it is called ‚Äòincorrect.‚Äô‚ÄùüîΩThe question beginning with ‚ÄúBlessed One, what is the practice that is not all-inclusive?‚Äù

original: bcom ldan 'das thams cad ma lags pa'i spyod pa gang lags zhes bya ba 'di man chad ni bzhi pa zhus pa dang / lan dag gis gong du bstan pa'i thabs ma yin pa'i spyod pa rnam par 'byed pa ston to //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das thams cad ma lags pa'i spyod pa gang lags zhes bya ba 'di man chad ni bzhi pa zhus pa dang / lan dag gis gong du bstan pa'i thabs ma yin pa'i spyod pa rnam par 'byed pa ston to //
translated: and the answer that follows present the fourth topic, the explanation of the distinctions between the practices that are not the method and those that are the method, which were taught above.

original: 'di yang rnam pa drug ste /
analyzed: 'di yang rnam pa drug ste /
translated: This is also sixfold:

original: zhu ba gsol ba dang / lan gsungs pa dang / brtag pa dang / rnam par bshad pa dang / dpes bstan pa dang / dpe dang don du sbyar ba ste /
analyzed: zhu ba gsol ba dang / lan gsungs pa dang / brtag pa dang / rnam par bshad pa dang / dpes bstan pa dang / dpe dang don du sbyar ba ste /
translated: the request, the reply, the analysis, the explanation, the teaching through examples, and the application of the examples to the meaning.

original: 'di ni dang po gong du bstan pa'i thabs ma yin pa'i spyod pa zhus pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni dang po gong du bstan pa'i thabs ma yin pa'i spyod pa zhus pa'o //
translated: This is the first request for the conduct that is not a method.

original: @53b rigs kyi bu gal te byang chub sems dpa' rnams pha rol tu phyin pa dag gis sems can la phan 'dogs pa na zang zing gi bsdu pas phan 'dogs pa nye bar bsgrub pa tsam gyis chog par 'dzin cing mi dge ba'i gnas nas bslangs te /
analyzed: @53b rigs kyi bu gal te byang chub sems dpa' rnams pha rol tu phyin pa dag gis sems can la phan 'dogs pa na zang zing gi bsdu pas phan 'dogs pa nye bar bsgrub pa tsam gyis chog par 'dzin cing mi dge ba'i gnas nas bslangs te /
translated: Son of noble family, if bodhisattvas, when benefiting sentient beings through the perfections, were to be satisfied with merely accomplishing the benefit through the attraction of material things and did not lift them from nonvirtue and establish them in virtue, that would be called the conduct that is a method.

original: dge ba'i gnas su 'jog par mi byed pa gang yin pa de ni thabs yin pa'i spyod pa zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa yang dag par lan du gsungs pa ste /
analyzed: dge ba'i gnas su 'jog par mi byed pa gang yin pa de ni thabs yin pa'i spyod pa zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa yang dag par lan du gsungs pa ste /
translated: This is the second correct reply.

original: 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' rnams bsdu ba'i dngos po bzhi las /
analyzed: 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' rnams bsdu ba'i dngos po bzhi las /
translated: Thus, bodhisattvas, through the four means of attraction,

original: zang zing gi bsdu ba kho nas phan 'dogs pas chog par 'dzin cing /
analyzed: zang zing gi bsdu ba kho nas phan 'dogs pas chog par 'dzin cing /
translated: are satisfied with merely benefiting through the attraction of material things.

original: gzhan dag mi dge ba'i gnas nas slong bar mi byed pa gang yin pa 'di ni thabs ma yin pa'i spyod pa zhes bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gzhan dag mi dge ba'i gnas nas slong bar mi byed pa gang yin pa 'di ni thabs ma yin pa'i spyod pa zhes bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This is called the practice that is not a method.üîΩWhy is that?

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya ba ni thabs ma yin pa'i spyod par gyur pa'i gtan tshigs brtag pa ste /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya ba ni thabs ma yin pa'i spyod par gyur pa'i gtan tshigs brtag pa ste /
translated: This is the investigation of the reason for being a practice that is not a method.

original: zang zing btang bas kyang pha rol dga' bar 'gyur bas phan 'dogs pa yin na /
analyzed: zang zing btang bas kyang pha rol dga' bar 'gyur bas phan 'dogs pa yin na /
translated: If, by giving material things, one causes others to be happy and thus benefits them,

original: don gang gi phyir thabs ma yin zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: don gang gi phyir thabs ma yin zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: why is it not a method? This is the meaning.üîΩSon of noble family, it is not the case that by doing just that much for sentient beings, one is said to be truly benefiting them.

original: rigs kyi bu sems can la dngos po de tsam zhig byas pas yang dag par phan btags pa zhes bya ba ma yin te zhes bya ba ni bzhi pa de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag par rnam par bshad pa ste /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu sems can la dngos po de tsam zhig byas pas yang dag par phan btags pa zhes bya ba ma yin te zhes bya ba ni bzhi pa de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag par rnam par bshad pa ste /
translated: This is the fourth correct explanation by the TathƒÅgata.

original: 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' rnams sems can la zang zing gis bsdus nas 'jig rten pa 'di dga' ba tsam byas pa yang phan btags pa zhes bya ba ma yin gyi /
analyzed: 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' rnams sems can la zang zing gis bsdus nas 'jig rten pa 'di dga' ba tsam byas pa yang phan btags pa zhes bya ba ma yin gyi /
translated: Thus, when bodhisattvas gather beings with material gifts and make them happy in this world, that is not called helping them.

original: chos kyi sbyin pa btang nas /
analyzed: chos kyi sbyin pa btang nas /
translated: But when they give the gift of Dharma

original: sems can rnams mi dge ba'i gnas nas bslang ba gang yin pa de ni gdod phan btags pa zhes bya bas so //
analyzed: sems can rnams mi dge ba'i gnas nas bslang ba gang yin pa de ni gdod phan btags pa zhes bya bas so //
translated: and lift beings out of nonvirtue, that is called helping them.üîΩJust as no amount of perfume will make a foul-smelling flower fragrant,üîΩno amount of pampering will make a bad person happy.

original: dper na mi gtsang ba ni che yang rung chung yang rung rnam grangs gang gis kyang dri zhim por bya bar mi nus so zhes bya ba ni lnga pa dpes nye bar mtshon pa ste /
analyzed: dper na mi gtsang ba ni che yang rung chung yang rung rnam grangs gang gis kyang dri zhim por bya bar mi nus so zhes bya ba ni lnga pa dpes nye bar mtshon pa ste /
translated: The foul-smelling flower is a metaphor for the fifth, illustrated by the example.

original: dper na 'jig rten na mi gtsang ba ni che yang rung chung yang rung nams kyang dri zhim po'i dngos por mi 'gyur ba bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na 'jig rten na mi gtsang ba ni che yang rung chung yang rung nams kyang dri zhim po'i dngos por mi 'gyur ba bzhin no //
translated: Just as no amount of perfume will make a foul-smelling flower fragrant, no matter how much you pamper bad people, they will never be happy.

original: de la mi gtsang ba ni 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal gyi dper bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de la mi gtsang ba ni 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal gyi dper bstan pa'o //
translated: Here, the foul-smelling flower illustrates the suffering of the formative forces.

original: dri zhim po ni mya ngan las 'das pa'i dper bstan pa'o //
analyzed: dri zhim po ni mya ngan las 'das pa'i dper bstan pa'o //
translated: The perfume illustrates nirvana.

original: de bzhin du sems can rnams kyang 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: de bzhin du sems can rnams kyang 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal nyid kyi phyir /
translated: So too, sentient beings are also the suffering of contaminated formations.üîΩSince their nature is also suffering, they are helpless.

original: de'i ngo bo nyid kyang sdug bsngal yin pas thabs med pa gang gis zang zing kho nas re zhig tsam du phan btags kyang bde ba nye bar bsgrub par mi nus kyi /
analyzed: de'i ngo bo nyid kyang sdug bsngal yin pas thabs med pa gang gis zang zing kho nas re zhig tsam du phan btags kyang bde ba nye bar bsgrub par mi nus kyi /
translated: If you help them for a while only with material things, you cannot establish them in virtue alone,

original: dge ba 'ba' zhig la 'jog @54a * //
analyzed: dge ba 'ba' zhig la 'jog @54a * //
translated: which is the supreme way to help them.

original: pa gang yin pa de ni gdod phan 'dogs pa'i mchog ces bya ba'i ming 'thob bo zhes bya ba ni drug pa dpe dang don sbyor ba ste /
analyzed: pa gang yin pa de ni gdod phan 'dogs pa'i mchog ces bya ba'i ming 'thob bo zhes bya ba ni drug pa dpe dang don sbyor ba ste /
translated: This is the sixth analogy, that of the doctor and patient, which illustrates the meaning of the above root verse.

original: 'di ltar sems can rnams 'du byed sdug bsngal nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: 'di ltar sems can rnams 'du byed sdug bsngal nyid kyi phyir /
translated: Thus, sentient beings are the suffering of contaminated formations.

original: de'i ngo bo nyid kyang sdug bsngal yin pas /
analyzed: de'i ngo bo nyid kyang sdug bsngal yin pas /
translated: Since their nature is also suffering,

original: nor dang / zas dang / skom tsam gyis phan btags pas bde ba nyid du mi 'gyur gyi byang chub kyi mya ngan las 'das pa dge ba'i chos gya nom pa la 'jog pa gang yin pa de 'ba' zhig ni phan 'dogs pa'i mchog ces bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: nor dang / zas dang / skom tsam gyis phan btags pas bde ba nyid du mi 'gyur gyi byang chub kyi mya ngan las 'das pa dge ba'i chos gya nom pa la 'jog pa gang yin pa de 'ba' zhig ni phan 'dogs pa'i mchog ces bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is not just by the benefit of wealth, food, and drink that one becomes happy, but rather it is only the establishment in the excellent virtues of enlightenment and nirvana that is called the supreme benefit.

original: byang chub sems dpa' spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug gis yang bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug gis yang bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Avalokitesvara Bodhisattva said to the Lord:

original: bcom ldan 'das pha rol tu phyin pa de dag gi rnam pa du mchis pa lags zhes bya ba ni 'di man chad ni dgu pa pha rol tu phyin pa rnam par dag pa'i grangs bstan pa'i sgo zhes bya ba ston to //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das pha rol tu phyin pa de dag gi rnam pa du mchis pa lags zhes bya ba ni 'di man chad ni dgu pa pha rol tu phyin pa rnam par dag pa'i grangs bstan pa'i sgo zhes bya ba ston to //
translated: How many aspects do those perfections have? From here on is the teaching of the ninth chapter called The Teaching of the Enumeration of the Purity of the Perfections.

original: 'di yang rnam pa gnyis po zhu ba gsol ba dang lan du gsungs pas bstan te /
analyzed: 'di yang rnam pa gnyis po zhu ba gsol ba dang lan du gsungs pas bstan te /
translated: This is also shown by the question and the answer in two parts.

original: 'di ni pha rol tu phyin pa drug po dag la rnam par dag pa'i phyir zhes zhus pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni pha rol tu phyin pa drug po dag la rnam par dag pa'i phyir zhes zhus pa'o //
translated: This is the question: Because of the purity of those six perfections.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis byang chub sems dpa' spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug la bka' stsal pa /üîΩrigs kyi bu nga ni nams kyang pha rol tu phyin pa rnams gong du bstan pa bzhi mtshan nyid lnga po ma gtogs par rnam par dag pa gzhan yod par mi smra mod kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni gnyis pa de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis byang chub sems dpa' spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug la bka' stsal pa / rigs kyi bu nga ni nams kyang pha rol tu phyin pa rnams gong du bstan pa bzhi mtshan nyid lnga po ma gtogs par rnam par dag pa gzhan yod par mi smra mod kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni gnyis pa de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag
translated: The Lord said to the Bodhisattva Avalokitesvara:üîΩSon of noble family, I never say that the perfections exist as something other than the five characteristics that I have taught above, such as the pure.

original: par lan du gsungs pa ston to //
analyzed: par lan du gsungs pa ston to //
translated: Thus, the second, the Tathagata's true reply, is shown.

original: 'di yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: 'di yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: This also has two parts:

original: snga ma lnga las rnam par dag pa gud na med par bstan pa dang / lnga po dag la brten nas bsdus pa dang / so so ba bdun gyi mtshan bstan pa ste /
analyzed: snga ma lnga las rnam par dag pa gud na med par bstan pa dang / lnga po dag la brten nas bsdus pa dang / so so ba bdun gyi mtshan bstan pa ste /
translated: showing that purity is not something else apart from the five, and showing the characteristics of the five individually and collectively.

original: 'di ni dang po'o //
analyzed: 'di ni dang po'o //
translated: This is the first.

original: 'di ltar nga ni gong du chags pa med pa nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba nas yang dag par yongs su bsngo ba nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba'i bar gyi mtshan nyid lnga po dag ma gtogs par gud na rnam par dag pa'i mtshan nyid yod par mi
analyzed: 'di ltar nga ni gong du chags pa med pa nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba nas yang dag par yongs su bsngo ba nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba'i bar gyi mtshan nyid lnga po dag ma gtogs par gud na rnam par dag pa'i mtshan nyid yod par mi
translated: Thus, he does not teach that the defining characteristics of purity exist elsewhere, except for the five characteristics beginning with ‚Äúbecause of the absence of attachment‚Äù and ending with ‚Äúbecause of the true dedication.‚Äù

original: gsung ngo zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gsung ngo zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This is the meaning.üîΩHowever, the defining characteristics of the purity of the perfections should be explained in terms of their inclusion and their individual bases, in terms of those entities and so on.

original: 'on kyang yang dngos po de dag gis bsdus pa dang ; so so ba la brten nas pha rol tu phyin pa rnams kyi ni rnam par dag pa'i mtshan nyid bshad par bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni gnyis pa lnga'i mtshan nyid snga ma la brten nas bsdus pa dang /üîΩso so ba bdun bstan pa'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang yang dngos po de dag gis bsdus pa dang ; so so ba la brten nas pha rol tu phyin pa rnams kyi ni rnam par dag pa'i mtshan nyid bshad par bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni gnyis pa lnga'i mtshan nyid snga ma la brten nas bsdus pa dang / so so ba bdun bstan pa'o //
translated: The second section explains the five characteristics of the five perfections in terms of their inclusion and their individual bases, in terms of the previous ones and the latter ones.

original: 'di yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: 'di yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: This is also twofold.

original: snga ma'i mtshan nyid rnam pa @54b lnga la brten nas bsdus pa dang / so so ba bdun gyi lan mdor gsungs pa dang / go rims bzhin du bsdus pa so so ba bdun mtshan nyid bstan pa ste /
analyzed: snga ma'i mtshan nyid rnam pa @54b lnga la brten nas bsdus pa dang / so so ba bdun gyi lan mdor gsungs pa dang / go rims bzhin du bsdus pa so so ba bdun mtshan nyid bstan pa ste /
translated: The summary based on the five characteristics of the former, the brief response to the seven individual questions, and the explanation of the seven individual characteristics in order.

original: 'di ni dang po'o //
analyzed: 'di ni dang po'o //
translated: This is the first.

original: de la dngos po de dag gi zhes bya ba ni pha rol tu phyin pa rnams la dngos po de dag ces bya bar bstan te /
analyzed: de la dngos po de dag gi zhes bya ba ni pha rol tu phyin pa rnams la dngos po de dag ces bya bar bstan te /
translated: Therein, ‚Äúthose things‚Äù refers to the perfections, which are called ‚Äúthose things.‚Äù

original: 'di ltar pha rol tu phyin pa de dag re re dag la yang so so nas bsdus pa dang / so so ba rnam pa bdun yod pas so //
analyzed: 'di ltar pha rol tu phyin pa de dag re re dag la yang so so nas bsdus pa dang / so so ba rnam pa bdun yod pas so //
translated: Thus, each of those perfections has seven individual and collective aspects.

original: de la pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad kyi rnam par dag pa'i mtshan nyid bsdus pa yang rnam pa bdun du rig par bya ste zhes bya ba la sogs pas gnyis pa go rims bzhin du rnam par phye ste bshad pa ston to //
analyzed: de la pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad kyi rnam par dag pa'i mtshan nyid bsdus pa yang rnam pa bdun du rig par bya ste zhes bya ba la sogs pas gnyis pa go rims bzhin du rnam par phye ste bshad pa ston to //
translated: Therein, the characteristic of the purification of all the perfections should be known as sevenfold, etc. This teaches the second, the explanation by way of the analysis in order.

original: 'di yang rnam pa gnyis su dbye ste /
analyzed: 'di yang rnam pa gnyis su dbye ste /
translated: This is also divided into two parts.

original: bsdus pa'i mtshan nyid bdun bstan pa dang / so so'i mtshan nyid bdun bstan pa'o //
analyzed: bsdus pa'i mtshan nyid bdun bstan pa dang / so so'i mtshan nyid bdun bstan pa'o //
translated: the teaching of the seven characteristics in brief, and the teaching of the seven individual characteristics.

original: dang po la yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: dang po la yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The first has two parts:

original: grangs mdor smos pa dang / zhus pa dang / lan dag gis rnam par phye nas bstan pa ste /
analyzed: grangs mdor smos pa dang / zhus pa dang / lan dag gis rnam par phye nas bstan pa ste /
translated: the brief statement of the enumeration, and the teaching through analysis by way of the question and answer.

original: 'di ni dang po mtshan nyid rnam pa bdun smos pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni dang po mtshan nyid rnam pa bdun smos pa'o //
translated: This is the first, the brief statement of the seven characteristics.

original: bdun gang zhe na /
analyzed: bdun gang zhe na /
translated: What are the seven?

original: byang chub sems dpa' chos de dag gis gzhan las shes kyi khe yongs su mi tshol ba zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni gnyis pa zhus pa dang / lan dag gi mtshan nyid rnam pa bdun rnam par phye nas bshad pa ston te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' chos de dag gis gzhan las shes kyi khe yongs su mi tshol ba zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni gnyis pa zhus pa dang / lan dag gi mtshan nyid rnam pa bdun rnam par phye nas bshad pa ston te /
translated: The second, the teaching of the seven characteristics through analysis by way of the question and answer, is shown by the passage beginning with ‚ÄúThe bodhisattva does not seek gain from others by means of those dharmas‚Äù and so on.

original: 'di ni mtshan nyid dang po bstan pa'o //üîΩ'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' ni gsang ste /
analyzed: 'di ni mtshan nyid dang po bstan pa'o // 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' ni gsang ste /
translated: This is the teaching of the first characteristic.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa drug spyod pas gzhan shes par byas nas grags pa dang rnyed pa mi tshol ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa drug spyod pas gzhan shes par byas nas grags pa dang rnyed pa mi tshol ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Thus the bodhisattva, by practicing the six perfections, makes others understand and does not seek fame and gain.

original: chos de dag la lta bas mngon par zhen par mi byed pa zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa mngon par zhen par mi byed pa'i mtshan nyid bstan pa ste 'khor gsum yongs su dag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos de dag la lta bas mngon par zhen par mi byed pa zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa mngon par zhen par mi byed pa'i mtshan nyid bstan pa ste 'khor gsum yongs su dag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Not to conceive a view of those dharmas is the second characteristic, that of not conceiving a view, because of the complete purity of the three spheres.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa drug po dag re re dag la yang gsum yongs su dag pa chen po ni theg pa chen po bsdus pa'i 'grel pa lang gi tshe bsgyur ba las rgya cher bstan to //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa drug po dag re re dag la yang gsum yongs su dag pa chen po ni theg pa chen po bsdus pa'i 'grel pa lang gi tshe bsgyur ba las rgya cher bstan to //
translated: The complete purity of each of the six perfections is taught in detail in the commentary on the MahƒÅyƒÅna Compendium, in the chapter on the transformation of life.

original: chos 'di dag byang chub chen po thob par gyur pa yin nam ma yin snyam du yid gnyis dang the tshom skyed par mi byed pa zhes bya ba ni gsum pa the tshom mi skyed pa'i mtshan nyid bstan pa ste /
analyzed: chos 'di dag byang chub chen po thob par gyur pa yin nam ma yin snyam du yid gnyis dang the tshom skyed par mi byed pa zhes bya ba ni gsum pa the tshom mi skyed pa'i mtshan nyid bstan pa ste /
translated: Not to arouse doubt as to whether or not these dharmas lead to the attainment of great enlightenment is the third characteristic, that of not arousing doubt,

original: mos pa bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mos pa bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because of the teaching on devotion.

original: bdag la mi bstod gzhan la mi smod cing gzhan dag la phrag dog mi byed pa yin no zhes bya ba ni bdag la bstod cing gzhan la mi smod pa'i mtshan nyid bstan pa ste /üîΩlci ba'i nyes par 'gyur @55a * //
analyzed: bdag la mi bstod gzhan la mi smod cing gzhan dag la phrag dog mi byed pa yin no zhes bya ba ni bdag la bstod cing gzhan la mi smod pa'i mtshan nyid bstan pa ste / lci ba'i nyes par 'gyur @55a * //
translated: This shows the characteristic of not praising oneself and not disparaging others.

original: ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because that would be a serious fault.

original: dregs par mi byed cing bag med par mi byed pa zhes 'byung ba ni /
analyzed: dregs par mi byed cing bag med par mi byed pa zhes 'byung ba ni /
translated: He is not arrogant and does not become negligent.

original: lnga pa bag med par mi byed pa'i mtshan nyid bstan pa ste /
analyzed: lnga pa bag med par mi byed pa'i mtshan nyid bstan pa ste /
translated: This shows the characteristic of not being negligent.

original: le lo dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: le lo dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because he is free from laziness.üîΩHe is not satisfied with a small amount or with a poor amount.

original: cung zad tsam dang ngan don tsam gyis chog par mi 'dzin pa zhes bya ba ni drug pa cho ga par mi 'dzin pa'i mtshan nyid bstan pa ste /
analyzed: cung zad tsam dang ngan don tsam gyis chog par mi 'dzin pa zhes bya ba ni drug pa cho ga par mi 'dzin pa'i mtshan nyid bstan pa ste /
translated: This shows the characteristic of not being satisfied with a small amount or a poor amount.

original: spyod pa rgya che ba rnams spyod cing yongs su skyo ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: spyod pa rgya che ba rnams spyod cing yongs su skyo ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because he practices with a vast scope of activity and is not discouraged.

original: chos de dag gis ser sna mi byed pa gzhan dag la phrag dog mi byed pa yin no zhes bya ba ni bdun pa phrag dog dang ser sna mi byed pa'i mtshan nyid bstan pa ste /
analyzed: chos de dag gis ser sna mi byed pa gzhan dag la phrag dog mi byed pa yin no zhes bya ba ni bdun pa phrag dog dang ser sna mi byed pa'i mtshan nyid bstan pa ste /
translated: He does not practice stinginess and envy with regard to those dharmas.

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni bdag nyid chos spyod pa'i phyir gzhan dag kyang spyod pa mthong na ser sna dang phrag dog gis zang zing dang chos la ser sna mi byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni bdag nyid chos spyod pa'i phyir gzhan dag kyang spyod pa mthong na ser sna dang phrag dog gis zang zing dang chos la ser sna mi byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The bodhisattva, because he himself practices the dharmas, does not practice stinginess and envy with regard to material things and the dharmas, because he sees others practicing.üîΩThe explanation of the individual characteristics of the perfections is also sevenfold.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa rnam par dag pa'i mtshan nyid so so tha dad par bstan pa yang rnam pa bdun yod do zhes bya ba ni 'di man chad gnyis pa so so tha dad pa'i mtshan nyid bstan pa'o //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa rnam par dag pa'i mtshan nyid so so tha dad par bstan pa yang rnam pa bdun yod do zhes bya ba ni 'di man chad gnyis pa so so tha dad pa'i mtshan nyid bstan pa'o //
translated: This is the second explanation of the individual characteristics.

original: 'di yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: 'di yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: This is also twofold:

original: grangs mdor smos pa dang / zhus pa dang lan dag gis pha rol tu phyin pa drug gi mtshan nyid bdun bstan pa ste /
analyzed: grangs mdor smos pa dang / zhus pa dang lan dag gis pha rol tu phyin pa drug gi mtshan nyid bdun bstan pa ste /
translated: a brief statement of the enumeration and the explanation of the questions and answers.

original: 'di ni dang po grangs mdor smos pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni dang po grangs mdor smos pa'o //
translated: This is the first, the brief statement of the enumeration.

original: bdun gang zhen /
analyzed: bdun gang zhen /
translated: What are the seven?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:üîΩThe bodhisattvas practice the seven aspects of purity just as they have been taught.

translated: How does one have morality that is engaged?

original: ral na yang phyir gso bar byed pa'i phyir ro //üîΩji ltar na bslab pa'i gzhi rnam pa drug yang dag par blangs te slob pa @57a * //
analyzed: ral na yang phyir gso bar byed pa'i phyir ro // ji ltar na bslab pa'i gzhi rnam pa drug yang dag par blangs te slob pa @57a * //
translated: Because one restores it when it is violated.

original: yin zhe na /
analyzed: yin zhe na /
translated: How does one have the six bases of training that are taken up and studied?

original: bslab pa mtha' dag rjes su bsrung ba'i phyir ro zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: bslab pa mtha' dag rjes su bsrung ba'i phyir ro zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: Because one protects the entire training.‚Äù

original: mtshan nyid 'di dag rgya cher bshad pa ni /
analyzed: mtshan nyid 'di dag rgya cher bshad pa ni /
translated: The extensive explanation of these characteristics is as follows.

original: bstan bcos rnam par bshad pa dang / rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las bstan pa bzhin du rig par bya'o //üîΩ'di ltar rtag pa'i tshul khrims dang ldan pa dang / brtan pa'i tshul khrims can gnyis kyis ni bslab pa mi dbul zhing /
analyzed: bstan bcos rnam par bshad pa dang / rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las bstan pa bzhin du rig par bya'o // 'di ltar rtag pa'i tshul khrims dang ldan pa dang / brtan pa'i tshul khrims can gnyis kyis ni bslab pa mi dbul zhing /
translated: It should be understood as taught in the treatises, the Vyakhyayukti and the Yogacaryabhami.

original: ral bar mi byed pas gnyis su ston to //üîΩrtag tu byed pa dang / rtag tu 'jug pa'i tshul khrims rnam pa gnyis kyis ni /üîΩnan tan gyis 'dral bar mi byed cing /
analyzed: ral bar mi byed pas gnyis su ston to // rtag tu byed pa dang / rtag tu 'jug pa'i tshul khrims rnam pa gnyis kyis ni / nan tan gyis 'dral bar mi byed cing /
translated: Thus, the two, the one who has constant morality and the one who has firm morality, are taught as the two who do not waste the training and do not violate it.

original: ral na yang bshags par byed pas gnyis su bstan to //üîΩbslab pa'i gzhi rnams yang dag par blangs te slob pa ni /
analyzed: ral na yang bshags par byed pas gnyis su bstan to // bslab pa'i gzhi rnams yang dag par blangs te slob pa ni /
translated: The two, the one who always acts and the one who always engages in morality, are taught as the two who do not violate it through practice and who confess it when they violate it.

original: bslab pa mtha' dag rjes su srung bar byed pas so //
analyzed: bslab pa mtha' dag rjes su srung bar byed pas so //
translated: The one who trains by taking up the bases of training is taught as the one who guards the whole training.

original: kha cig na re rnam pa bdun las dang po gnyis ni sdom pa'i tshul khrims so //
analyzed: kha cig na re rnam pa bdun las dang po gnyis ni sdom pa'i tshul khrims so //
translated: Some say: From the seven aspects, the first two are the morality of vow.

original: de'i 'og ma gnyis ni dge ba ba sdud pa'i tshul khrims so //
analyzed: de'i 'og ma gnyis ni dge ba ba sdud pa'i tshul khrims so //
translated: The next two are the morality of gathering virtue.

original: de'i 'og ma gnyis ni sems can la phan 'dogs pa'i tshul khrims so //
analyzed: de'i 'og ma gnyis ni sems can la phan 'dogs pa'i tshul khrims so //
translated: The next two are the morality of benefiting sentient beings.

original: tha ma gcig ni snga ma gsum spyir bsdus pa yin no zhe'o //
analyzed: tha ma gcig ni snga ma gsum spyir bsdus pa yin no zhe'o //
translated: The last one is the general inclusion of the former three.üîΩThis is called the seven characteristics of pure morality.

original: de'i tshul khrims rnam par dag pa'i mtshan nyid bdun zhes bya'o zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa mjug bsdu ba yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i tshul khrims rnam par dag pa'i mtshan nyid bdun zhes bya'o zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa mjug bsdu ba yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: The second is the conclusion.üîΩThe bodhisattva who, based on his own karma, has complete confidence in the results of evolution, does not arouse internal conflict when all kinds of harm are present.

original: byang chub sems dpa' gang gis bdag nyid kyi las kyi rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu la shin tu mngon par yid ches pa la brten pas gnod pa thams cad nye bar gnas pa nang 'khrug pa mi bskyed pa zhes bya ba 'di man chad ni gsum pa
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' gang gis bdag nyid kyi las kyi rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu la shin tu mngon par yid ches pa la brten pas gnod pa thams cad nye bar gnas pa nang 'khrug pa mi bskyed pa zhes bya ba 'di man chad ni gsum pa
translated: From here on is the third,

original: bzod pa'i mtshan nyid rnam pa bdun bstan to //
analyzed: bzod pa'i mtshan nyid rnam pa bdun bstan to //
translated: the teaching of the seven characteristics of patience.

original: 'di yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: 'di yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: This also has two parts:

original: rnam par bshad pa dang mjug bsdu ba'o //
analyzed: rnam par bshad pa dang mjug bsdu ba'o //
translated: the explanation and the conclusion.

original: rnam par bshad pa yang mtshan nyid rnam pa bdun bstan pa nyid las bdun du phye ste /
analyzed: rnam par bshad pa yang mtshan nyid rnam pa bdun bstan pa nyid las bdun du phye ste /
translated: The explanation is divided into seven parts from the teaching of the seven characteristics.

original: 'di ni mtshan nyid dang po bstan pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni mtshan nyid dang po bstan pa'o //
translated: This is the first characteristic.

original: 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' rnams rgyu dang 'bras bu la shin tu mngon par yid ches pas bdag nyid kyi las kyis mi mthun pa'i yul mngon du gyur pa na 'khrug pa skyed par mi byed de de la las mngon par yid ches pa gang yin pa
analyzed: 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' rnams rgyu dang 'bras bu la shin tu mngon par yid ches pas bdag nyid kyi las kyis mi mthun pa'i yul mngon du gyur pa na 'khrug pa skyed par mi byed de de la las mngon par yid ches pa gang yin pa
translated: Thus, bodhisattvas, through their intense conviction in cause and effect, do not give rise to anger when they encounter adverse circumstances due to their own karma.

original: de ni bzod pa'i rgyu'o /
analyzed: de ni bzod pa'i rgyu'o /
translated: The cause of patience is the conviction in karma.

original: gnod pa'i dngos po gang yin pa de ni bzod par bya ba'i yul lo //
analyzed: gnod pa'i dngos po gang yin pa de ni bzod par bya ba'i yul lo //
translated: The object of patience is the thing that harms.

original: 'khrug pa mi skyed pa gang yin pa de ni bzod pa'i ngo bo nyid de /
analyzed: 'khrug pa mi skyed pa gang yin pa de ni bzod pa'i ngo bo nyid de /
translated: The essence of patience is the absence of anger.

original: rgyu dang rkyen 'di gsum gyi mtshan nyid dang po bstan to //
analyzed: rgyu dang rkyen 'di gsum gyi mtshan nyid dang po bstan to //
translated: These three characteristics have been taught.

original: gzhan yang bstan bcos @57b rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las 'di lta ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang bstan bcos @57b rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las 'di lta ste /
translated: Moreover, the Bodhisattvabhumi states:

original: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' ni gzhan gnod pa byed pa las byung ba'i sdug bsngal mi bzad pa rgyun mi 'chad pa sna tshogs yun ring ba mngon du byed pa la 'di ltar yang dag par slob ste /
analyzed: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' ni gzhan gnod pa byed pa las byung ba'i sdug bsngal mi bzad pa rgyun mi 'chad pa sna tshogs yun ring ba mngon du byed pa la 'di ltar yang dag par slob ste /
translated: Here, the bodhisattva trains himself correctly in this way:

original: 'di ni rang gi las kyi le lan yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni rang gi las kyi le lan yin te /
translated: ‚ÄúThis is the fault of my own karma.

original: des na bdag rang gis byas pa'i mi dge ba'i las kyi sdug bsngal gyi 'bras bu nyams su myong la /
analyzed: des na bdag rang gis byas pa'i mi dge ba'i las kyi sdug bsngal gyi 'bras bu nyams su myong la /
translated: Therefore, I am experiencing the result of nonvirtuous karma that I myself have created.

original: bdag ni sdug bsngal mi 'dod de /
analyzed: bdag ni sdug bsngal mi 'dod de /
translated: I do not want suffering.

original: mi bzod pa de phyi ma la yang sdug bsngal gyi rgyu'i gnas su 'gyur la /
analyzed: mi bzod pa de phyi ma la yang sdug bsngal gyi rgyu'i gnas su 'gyur la /
translated: That impatience will be the basis for suffering in the future.

original: bdag gi sdug bsngal gyi rgyur gyur ba'i chos de yang dag par blangs te /
analyzed: bdag gi sdug bsngal gyi rgyur gyur ba'i chos de yang dag par blangs te /
translated: I will take up the things that are the cause of my suffering.

original: 'dug na ni bdag nyid mi sdug pa gang yin pa de la bdag nyid kyis bdag nyid sbyor bar byed par nges so zhes bya ba la sogs ba rgya cher de nyid las bstan pa bzhin no //
analyzed: 'dug na ni bdag nyid mi sdug pa gang yin pa de la bdag nyid kyis bdag nyid sbyor bar byed par nges so zhes bya ba la sogs ba rgya cher de nyid las bstan pa bzhin no //
translated: If I remain in that, I will certainly apply myself to what is ugly.‚Äù

original: lan bya ba'i phyir slar yang spyo pa dang / gshe ba dang / rdeg pa dang / bsdigs pa dang / mtshang 'bru ba'i gnod pa sna tshogs sbyor bar mi byed pa zhes bya bas ni mtshan nyid gnyis pa bstan to //üîΩ'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' rnams stong pa nyid rnam pa gnyis rab tu rtogs par spyod ba mi dmigs pa dang / gzhan yang bzod pa myur du 'grub pa'i phyir /
analyzed: lan bya ba'i phyir slar yang spyo pa dang / gshe ba dang / rdeg pa dang / bsdigs pa dang / mtshang 'bru ba'i gnod pa sna tshogs sbyor bar mi byed pa zhes bya bas ni mtshan nyid gnyis pa bstan to // 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' rnams stong pa nyid rnam pa gnyis rab tu rtogs par spyod ba mi dmigs pa dang / gzhan yang bzod pa myur du 'grub pa'i phyir /
translated: The second characteristic is indicated by the words: ‚ÄúHe does not engage in various kinds of harm, such as scolding, reviling, beating, threatening, and exposing the faults of others in return.‚Äù

original: lan mi bzod par byed de /
analyzed: lan mi bzod par byed de /
translated: Thus, because the bodhisattvas have realized the two kinds of emptiness, they practice nonapprehending and also do not retaliate in order to quickly achieve patience.

original: gal te lan bya bar gyur na /
analyzed: gal te lan bya bar gyur na /
translated: If they retaliated,

original: phan yon chen po las rab tu nyams par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phan yon chen po las rab tu nyams par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: they would lose the great benefit.

original: gzhan yang bstan bcos rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las /
analyzed: gzhan yang bstan bcos rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las /
translated: Moreover, the Bodhisattvabhumi states:

original: 'di la gshe bar byed pa dang / gshe bar bya ba dang / khro bar bya ba dang / mtshang 'bru bar byed pa dang / mtshang 'bru bar bya ba dang / rdeg par byed pa dang / brdeg par bya ba 'ga' yang med do //
analyzed: 'di la gshe bar byed pa dang / gshe bar bya ba dang / khro bar bya ba dang / mtshang 'bru bar byed pa dang / mtshang 'bru bar bya ba dang / rdeg par byed pa dang / brdeg par bya ba 'ga' yang med do //
translated: Here there is no one who reviles, no one who is reviled, no one who is angry, no one who insults, no one who is insulted, no one who strikes, and no one who is struck.

original: 'di dag ni yi ge dag gis brjod par bya ba kho nar zad pas /
analyzed: 'di dag ni yi ge dag gis brjod par bya ba kho nar zad pas /
translated: These are merely words.

original: de dag gi sgra tsam dang skad tsam du zad pa'i phyir dang / gzhan yang bdag gang la gnas pa'i lus 'di la 'di lta ste /üîΩsgra'i reg pa dang / lag pa dang bong ba dang / dbyug pa dang / mtshon cha'i reg pa'i reg pa de lta bu dag 'ong bar 'gyur ba'i lus 'di ni gzugs can rags pa /
analyzed: de dag gi sgra tsam dang skad tsam du zad pa'i phyir dang / gzhan yang bdag gang la gnas pa'i lus 'di la 'di lta ste / sgra'i reg pa dang / lag pa dang bong ba dang / dbyug pa dang / mtshon cha'i reg pa'i reg pa de lta bu dag 'ong bar 'gyur ba'i lus 'di ni gzugs can rags pa /
translated: They are just sounds and voices. Moreover, this body, in which I abide, is a gross physical body.üîΩIt is made of the four great elements, and it is the kind of body in which such contacts as the contact of sound, the contact of hands, clods of earth, sticks, and weapons can occur.

original: 'byung ba chen po bzhi las gyur ba de lta bu yin te /
analyzed: 'byung ba chen po bzhi las gyur ba de lta bu yin te /
translated: It is a gross physical body,

original: bdag gi lus 'di yang mi rtag pa yin pa la reg pa de dang de dag dang / gnod par byed pa de dag kyang mi rtag pa yin pa'i phyir dang / gzhan yang sems can thams cad ni /
analyzed: bdag gi lus 'di yang mi rtag pa yin pa la reg pa de dang de dag dang / gnod par byed pa de dag kyang mi rtag pa yin pa'i phyir dang / gzhan yang sems can thams cad ni /
translated: Moreover, all sentient beings

original: skye ba dang / rga ba dang / na ba dang / @58a * //
analyzed: skye ba dang / rga ba dang / na ba dang / @58a * //
translated: are subject to birth, aging, sickness,

original: 'chi ba'i chos can yin te /
analyzed: 'chi ba'i chos can yin te /
translated: and death.

original: de dag ni rang bzhin gyis sdug bsngal ba yin pas /
analyzed: de dag ni rang bzhin gyis sdug bsngal ba yin pas /
translated: Since they are naturally suffering,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis yun ring po 'das pa nas /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis yun ring po 'das pa nas /
translated: the BhagavƒÅn has said for a long time:üîΩ‚ÄúI do not see any sentient being at allüîΩwho has not been your parent,üîΩsibling, son, daughter, preceptor,

original: gang dag khyed kyi pha ma dang / phu nu dang / bu sring dang / mkhan po dang / slob dpon dang / bla ma dang / bla ma lta bur gyur ba'i sems can de lta bu ni 'ga' yang yang dag par rjes su ma mthong ngo zhes gsungs pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: gang dag khyed kyi pha ma dang / phu nu dang / bu sring dang / mkhan po dang / slob dpon dang / bla ma dang / bla ma lta bur gyur ba'i sems can de lta bu ni 'ga' yang yang dag par rjes su ma mthong ngo zhes gsungs pa'i phyir te /
translated: teacher, guru, or guru-like person.‚Äù

original: de'i phyir rnam grangs des kyang mdza' bshes kyi phyogs nyid kyang dgra bo'i phyogs yin la dgra bo'i phyogs nyid kyang mdza' bshes kyi phyogs yin pas 'di la mdza' bshes dang / dgra bo'i dngos po 'ga' yang yongs su grub pa med de /
analyzed: de'i phyir rnam grangs des kyang mdza' bshes kyi phyogs nyid kyang dgra bo'i phyogs yin la dgra bo'i phyogs nyid kyang mdza' bshes kyi phyogs yin pas 'di la mdza' bshes dang / dgra bo'i dngos po 'ga' yang yongs su grub pa med de /
translated: Therefore, there is no established entity of friend or enemy.

original: mdza' bshes la la dgra bor 'gyur la /
analyzed: mdza' bshes la la dgra bor 'gyur la /
translated: Some friends become enemies.

original: dgra bo yang mdza' bshes su 'gyur bas /
analyzed: dgra bo yang mdza' bshes su 'gyur bas /
translated: Some enemies become friends.

original: de'i phyir bdag gis sems can thams cad la sems mnyam pa nyid dang / lta ba mnyam pa nyid dang / phan pa'i bsam pa dang / bde ba'i bsam pa dang ; bde ba nye bar sgrub pa dang / bde ba nye bar sgrub par smos pa nyid du bya'o snyam du sems pa ste zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir bdag gis sems can thams cad la sems mnyam pa nyid dang / lta ba mnyam pa nyid dang / phan pa'i bsam pa dang / bde ba'i bsam pa dang ; bde ba nye bar sgrub pa dang / bde ba nye bar sgrub par smos pa nyid du bya'o snyam du sems pa ste zhes 'byung ste /
translated: Therefore, I should think, ‚ÄúI will have an attitude of sameness toward all sentient beings, an attitude of sameness in view, an attitude of benefit, an attitude of happiness, and I will accomplish happiness and speak of accomplishing happiness.‚Äù

original: de lta bu'i bsam gtan gyi bzod pa sgom par byed do //
analyzed: de lta bu'i bsam gtan gyi bzod pa sgom par byed do //
translated: Thus, one should cultivate the patience of meditative stabilization.

original: khon gyi bsam pa mi mdzad pa zhes bya bas ni mtshan nyid gsum bstan pa ste /
analyzed: khon gyi bsam pa mi mdzad pa zhes bya bas ni mtshan nyid gsum bstan pa ste /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúwithout an attitude of enmity‚Äù indicates the three characteristics.

original: bzod pa'i phan yon khong du chud par gyur na 'dod pa gdon mi za bar khon du 'dzin pa med de /
analyzed: bzod pa'i phan yon khong du chud par gyur na 'dod pa gdon mi za bar khon du 'dzin pa med de /
translated: If one understands the benefits of patience, one will certainly not hold on to anger.

original: de'i phyir bstan bcos rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las gzhan dag gis gnod pa byas pa na phyir gnod pa yang mi byed pa dang / yid 'khrugs par yang mi 'gyur ba dang / dgrar bsam par yang mi 'dzin la /
analyzed: de'i phyir bstan bcos rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las gzhan dag gis gnod pa byas pa na phyir gnod pa yang mi byed pa dang / yid 'khrugs par yang mi 'gyur ba dang / dgrar bsam par yang mi 'dzin la /
translated: Therefore, the Bodhisattvabhumi states that when others harm one, one does not return the harm, one's mind does not get upset, and one does not think of them as an enemy.

original: sngar ji lta ba bzhin du phyis kyang phan 'dogs pa'i phyir brtson par byed ces bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: sngar ji lta ba bzhin du phyis kyang phan 'dogs pa'i phyir brtson par byed ces bstan pa yin no //
translated: And just as before, one strives to help them later on.

original: shad kyis chags pa na yongs su nyon mongs par mi byed pa zhes bya ba ni mtshan nyid bzhi pa bstan pa ste /
analyzed: shad kyis chags pa na yongs su nyon mongs par mi byed pa zhes bya ba ni mtshan nyid bzhi pa bstan pa ste /
translated: When they apologize, one does not get upset. This shows the fourth characteristic.

original: dgra bo dag gis shad kyis 'chags su 'ong ba'i tshe bshags pa dang du len cing nyon mongs pa skyed par mi byed pa ste /
analyzed: dgra bo dag gis shad kyis 'chags su 'ong ba'i tshe bshags pa dang du len cing nyon mongs pa skyed par mi byed pa ste /
translated: When enemies come to apologize for their offense, one accepts their apology and does not give rise to any affliction.

original: de'i phyir bstan bcos rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las /
analyzed: de'i phyir bstan bcos rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las /
translated: Therefore, the Bodhisattvabhumi states:

original: pha rol yongs su ngal bar byas pa'i 'og tu chags pa mi len gyi /
analyzed: pha rol yongs su ngal bar byas pa'i 'og tu chags pa mi len gyi /
translated: He does not accept confession from the other when he is tired.

original: de yongs su skyo zhing ngal bar 'gyur bar dogs nas 'ongs ma thag tu 'chags pa len par byed do zhes bshad do //
analyzed: de yongs su skyo zhing ngal bar 'gyur bar dogs nas 'ongs ma thag tu 'chags pa len par byed do zhes bshad do //
translated: Fearing that the other would become tired and weary, he goes to the other as soon as he is rested and accepts the confession.

original: dgongs @58b pa zab mo rnam par dgrol ba'i mdo las ni /
analyzed: dgongs @58b pa zab mo rnam par dgrol ba'i mdo las ni /
translated: The Sutra Unravelling the Intended Meaning says:

original: gal te bshags par gsol ba 'debs na dus bzhin du len par byed pas gzhan la gnod pa mi skyed pa zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: gal te bshags par gsol ba 'debs na dus bzhin du len par byed pas gzhan la gnod pa mi skyed pa zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: If you request confession, you should accept it in a timely way, without causing harm to others.

original: shad kyis 'chags pa sdod pa zhes bya bas ni mtshan nyid lnga pa bstan te /
analyzed: shad kyis 'chags pa sdod pa zhes bya bas ni mtshan nyid lnga pa bstan te /
translated: The line ‚ÄúConfession is accepted through the power of the other‚Äù teaches the fifth characteristic.

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni dgra bos byang chub sems dpa' nyid la gnod pa byed du dogs pas /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni dgra bos byang chub sems dpa' nyid la gnod pa byed du dogs pas /
translated: Because the bodhisattva fears that the enemy might harm the bodhisattva,

original: byang chub sems dpa' nyid myur du dgra bo de nyid du 'gro zhing bshags par byed gyi /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' nyid myur du dgra bo de nyid du 'gro zhing bshags par byed gyi /
translated: the bodhisattva quickly goes to the enemy and confesses.

original: pha rol 'ongs pa la bsdad nas bshags pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: pha rol 'ongs pa la bsdad nas bshags pa ni ma yin no //
translated: He does not accept confession from the other when the other comes to him.

original: bstan bcos rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las kyang /
analyzed: bstan bcos rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las kyang /
translated: The Levels of Yogic Deeds says:

original: khon yod pa dag la bdag nyid 'gro zhing bshags par byed do zhes bshad do //
analyzed: khon yod pa dag la bdag nyid 'gro zhing bshags par byed do zhes bshad do //
translated: and he goes to those who have a grudge against him and confesses.

original: mtshams rnam par dgrol ba'i mdo las ni /
analyzed: mtshams rnam par dgrol ba'i mdo las ni /
translated: The Sutra Unravelling the Intended Meaning says:

original: gal te gzhan gyis gnod par byas na yang mi brjed par 'chags par byed pa zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: gal te gzhan gyis gnod par byas na yang mi brjed par 'chags par byed pa zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: Even if others harm you, do not forget forgiveness.

original: 'jigs pa dang zang zing gi sems kyis bzod par byed pa ma yin pa zhes bya bas ni mtshan nyid drug pa bstan te /
analyzed: 'jigs pa dang zang zing gi sems kyis bzod par byed pa ma yin pa zhes bya bas ni mtshan nyid drug pa bstan te /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúnot through fear or a desire for material things‚Äù indicates the sixth and seventh characteristics.

original: 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni 'jigs pa'i phyir bzod par byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni 'jigs pa'i phyir bzod par byed pa ma yin te /
translated: Thus, bodhisattvas are not forbearing out of fear,

original: dper na rgyal po la sogs pa la 'jigs pa lta bu ni ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: dper na rgyal po la sogs pa la 'jigs pa lta bu ni ma yin pa'o //
translated: as, for example, out of fear of a king.

original: zang zing gi sems kyis yongs su tshol bar byed pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: zang zing gi sems kyis yongs su tshol bar byed pa yang ma yin te /

original: skur ba kho na yod do zhes bshad de /

original: 'di lta ste /

analyzed: de la shes bya ni 'di lta ste /

original: de la shes bya ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de la shes bya ni 'di lta ste /

original: nges par 'byung ba nyid du bsgom pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: nges par 'byung ba nyid du bsgom pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is the apprehension of the selflessness of sentient beings and of formations, the apprehension of the selflessness of the conventional as a conceptual dharma in regard to signs, and the cultivation of cessation as cessation, as peace, as sublime, and as definitive release.

translated: It is the meditation on impermanence, suffering, impurity, sickness, boils, and pain.üîΩThe meditation on emptiness is the knowledge that focuses on the meditation on cause, origination, appearance, and condition, and the meditation on the path, the right path, the practice, and the definite emergence as the path of emptiness.

translated: The cultivation of the path of wishlessness as a path, a method, a practice, and a deliverance by any cognition that takes it as its object is also the cultivation of wishlessness.

analyzed: gal te bye brag med par kun la yang stong ba nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa zhes brjod na ni //
translated: If it is said that all of them are empty, signless, and wishless without distinction,

analyzed: thos pa dang / bsam pa dang / bsgom pa las byung ba'i shes rab 'jig rten pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa yin par rig par bya'o ;

analyzed: de ni 'jig rten pa las 'das pa kho na yin par rig par bya'o zhes 'byung ste /

original: rgya cher rnam par 'byed pa ni /
analyzed: rgya cher rnam par 'byed pa ni /
translated: The extensive analysis

analyzed: ngo bo nyid dang bsam pa'i don ni 'di lta ste /
