analyzed: de dag kha cig gis phyis za zhing gcin 'thungs te gang mi gtsang zhing mnam la dring ba dang / gnod pa dang smad par bya ba de ni za pa'am 'thung bar nus so //
translated: Some of them are able to eat or drink what is impure, foul-smelling, disgusting, harmful, and contemptible.

original: yang kha cig ni rang gi sha rnams kyang bcad de za la /
analyzed: yang kha cig ni rang gi sha rnams kyang bcad de za la /
translated: Some of them are able to cut off their own flesh and eat it.

original: gtsang ba'am bsod pa gang yin pa de ni bza' ba dang btung bar mi nus te /
analyzed: gtsang ba'am bsod pa gang yin pa de ni bza' ba dang btung bar mi nus te /
translated: But whatever is pure and good, they are unable to eat or drink.

original: de lta bu de dag ni zas dang skom la sgrib pa med pa'i yi dvags rnams zhes bya ba zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de lta bu de dag ni zas dang skom la sgrib pa med pa'i yi dvags rnams zhes bya ba zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: Those like this are called ‚Äúhungry ghosts with an obscuration with regard to food and drink.‚Äù

original: byang chub sems dpa' spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug gis yang bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //üîΩbcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpas pha rol tu phyin pa dag gis chos thams cad kyi ngo bo nyid ma mchis pa nyid 'dzin par bgyi lags zhes bya ba 'di man chad ni bcu bdun pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pas chos rnams kyi ngo
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug gis yang bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to // bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpas pha rol tu phyin pa dag gis chos thams cad kyi ngo bo nyid ma mchis pa nyid 'dzin par bgyi lags zhes bya ba 'di man chad ni bcu bdun pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pas chos rnams kyi ngo
translated: The Bodhisattva Avalokite≈õvara again addressed the BhagavƒÅn:üîΩ‚ÄúBhagavƒÅn, how do Bodhisattvas apprehend the lack of inherent nature of all phenomena through the perfections?‚Äù

original: bo nyid med pa yongs su 'dzin pa bstan pa'i sgo zhes bya ba ston to //
analyzed: bo nyid med pa yongs su 'dzin pa bstan pa'i sgo zhes bya ba ston to //
translated: From here onward, up to ‚ÄúThe perfection of wisdom is the gateway to the full apprehension of the lack of inherent nature of phenomena,‚Äù it teaches the seventeenth chapter.

original: 'di yang rnam pa lngas bstan te /
analyzed: 'di yang rnam pa lngas bstan te /
translated: This is also taught in five parts:

original: zhu ba gsol ba dang / lan gsungs pa dang / gal du gsol ba dang / rung ba nyid du sgrub pa dang / mjug bsdu ba'o //
analyzed: zhu ba gsol ba dang / lan gsungs pa dang / gal du gsol ba dang / rung ba nyid du sgrub pa dang / mjug bsdu ba'o //
translated: the request, the reply, the request for clarification, the establishment of suitability, and the conclusion.

original: 'di ni dang po byang chub sems dpas zhu ba gsol ba ste /
analyzed: 'di ni dang po byang chub sems dpas zhu ba gsol ba ste /
translated: This is the first request by the Bodhisattva.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa drug po dag las pha rol tu phyin pa gang gis chos rnams kyi ngo bo nyid ma mchis pa nyid 'dzin par bgyid ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa drug po dag las pha rol tu phyin pa gang gis chos rnams kyi ngo bo nyid ma mchis pa nyid 'dzin par bgyid ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Which of the six perfections does one hold through in order to hold the realitylessness of all things?

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis byang chub sems dpa' spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug la bka' stsal ba /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis byang chub sems dpa' spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug la bka' stsal ba /
translated: The Lord said to the Bodhisattva Avalokitesvara:üîΩSon of good family, it is thus: one holds the realitylessness of all things through the perfection of wisdom.

original: rigs kyi bu 'di ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pas chos rnams kyi ngo bo nyid med pa 'dzin par byed do zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag par lan du gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: rigs kyi bu 'di ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pas chos rnams kyi ngo bo nyid med pa 'dzin par byed do zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag par lan du gsungs pa'o //
translated: This is the second correct answer of the Tathagata.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa drug las shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa drug las shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The perfection of wisdom is the realitylessness of the perfection of wisdom, because of the realitylessness of the six perfections.

original: chos rnams kyi ngo bo nyid med pa nyi du 'dzin par @75a * //
analyzed: chos rnams kyi ngo bo nyid med pa nyi du 'dzin par @75a * //
translated: One holds the realitylessness of all things through the perfection of wisdom.

original: byed de ; 'dir gsungs pa'i ngo bo nyid med pa nyid ni /
analyzed: byed de ; 'dir gsungs pa'i ngo bo nyid med pa nyid ni /
translated: The realitylessness taught here is the realitylessness of all things, because of the realitylessness of the six perfections.üîΩ The realitylessness of all things is the realitylessness of the perfection of wisdom, because of the realitylessness of the six perfections.üîΩ The realitylessness of the perfection of wisdom is the realitylessness of the perfection of wisdom, because of the realitylessness of the six perfections.

original: de bzhin ngo bo nyid med pa nyid do //
analyzed: de bzhin ngo bo nyid med pa nyid do //
translated: And also, the lack of intrinsic reality.

original: yang na ngo bo nyid med pa rnam pa gsum mo //
analyzed: yang na ngo bo nyid med pa rnam pa gsum mo //
translated: Or else, the three kinds of lack of intrinsic reality.

original: bcom ldan 'das gal te shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pas chos rnams kyi ngo bo nyid ma mchis pa nyid 'dzin pa lags na /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das gal te shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pas chos rnams kyi ngo bo nyid ma mchis pa nyid 'dzin pa lags na /
translated: Blessed One, if the perfection of wisdom apprehends the lack of intrinsic reality of phenomena,üîΩwhy does it not apprehend them as having intrinsic reality?

original: ci'i slad du ngo bo nyid dang bcas pa nyid du 'dzin par mi bgyid lags zhes bya ba ni gsum pa byang chub sems dpa' gal gsol ba nyid de /
analyzed: ci'i slad du ngo bo nyid dang bcas pa nyid du 'dzin par mi bgyid lags zhes bya ba ni gsum pa byang chub sems dpa' gal gsol ba nyid de /
translated: This is the third question of the bodhisattva Maitreya.

original: de ni 'di skad du gal te ngo bo nyid ma mchis pa nyid kyang 'dzin par byed na /
analyzed: de ni 'di skad du gal te ngo bo nyid ma mchis pa nyid kyang 'dzin par byed na /
translated: This is what he means: if it apprehends the lack of intrinsic reality,

original: 'o na ni mngon par zhen pa nyid du gyur pas /
analyzed: 'o na ni mngon par zhen pa nyid du gyur pas /
translated: then it becomes just attachment.

original: mngon par zhen pa yang 'dzin par rigs na ci'i slad du ngo bo nyid med pa nyid dang bcas pa nyid 'dzin par mi bgyid ces bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mngon par zhen pa yang 'dzin par rigs na ci'i slad du ngo bo nyid med pa nyid dang bcas pa nyid 'dzin par mi bgyid ces bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: So it would be reasonable to apprehend attachment, but why does it not apprehend them as having intrinsic reality?

original: bshad pa'i rnam pa gzhan du na /
analyzed: bshad pa'i rnam pa gzhan du na /
translated: If it is explained in another way,

original: gal te shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pas chos rnams kyi ngo bo nyid med pa nyid kyang 'dzin par byed na ni /
analyzed: gal te shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pas chos rnams kyi ngo bo nyid med pa nyid kyang 'dzin par byed na ni /
translated: If the perfection of wisdom apprehends the realitylessness of things,

original: ngo bo nyid dang bcas pa nyid kyang 'dzin par 'gyur ba'i rigs te /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid dang bcas pa nyid kyang 'dzin par 'gyur ba'i rigs te /
translated: then it would be reasonable that it would also apprehend their reality,

original: 'di ltar de bzhin nyid kyi rnam pa gcig la ngo bo nyid dang bcas pa dang / ngo bo nyid med pa'i don tshang bar yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar de bzhin nyid kyi rnam pa gcig la ngo bo nyid dang bcas pa dang / ngo bo nyid med pa'i don tshang bar yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because in this way, the meaning of reality and realitylessness would be complete in the one aspect of thusness.

original: yang na ngo bo nyid med pa nyid rnam pa gsum po dag la yang ngo bo nyid med pa dang / ngo bo nyid dang bcas pa'i don yang rnam pa gnyis kyang yod na ci'i phyir ngo bo nyid dang bcas pa'i don 'dzin par mi byed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //üîΩrigs kyi bu nga ni nam yang ngo bo nyid med pa nyid kyis /
analyzed: yang na ngo bo nyid med pa nyid rnam pa gsum po dag la yang ngo bo nyid med pa dang / ngo bo nyid dang bcas pa'i don yang rnam pa gnyis kyang yod na ci'i phyir ngo bo nyid dang bcas pa'i don 'dzin par mi byed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go // rigs kyi bu nga ni nam yang ngo bo nyid med pa nyid kyis /
translated: Or else, if the three kinds of realitylessness also have the two kinds of meaning of realitylessness and reality, then why does it not apprehend the meaning of reality?üîΩThis is the meaning of the passage.üîΩ‚ÄúSon of noble family, I never say that realitylessness apprehends realitylessness.‚Äù

original: ngo bo nyid med pa nyid 'dzin par mi smra mod kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa bzhi pa /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid med pa nyid 'dzin par mi smra mod kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa bzhi pa /
translated: This is the fourth passage.

original: de bzhin gshegs pas rung ba nyid du sgrub pa bstan to //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas rung ba nyid du sgrub pa bstan to //
translated: The Tathagata has taught the establishment of what is possible.

original: 'di yang rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: 'di yang rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: This also is threefold:

original: bzlog pa'i rnam par bshad pa dang / rjes su mthun pa'i rnam par bshad pa dang / rgol ba'i lan bstan pa'o //
analyzed: bzlog pa'i rnam par bshad pa dang / rjes su mthun pa'i rnam par bshad pa dang / rgol ba'i lan bstan pa'o //
translated: the explanation of the reversal, the explanation of the conformity, and the explanation of the response to the dispute.

original: 'di ni bzlog pa'i rnam par bshad pas pha rol gyis brgal ba'i lan btab pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni bzlog pa'i rnam par bshad pas pha rol gyis brgal ba'i lan btab pa'o //
translated: This is the response to the opponent's dispute through the explanation of the reversal.

original: 'di la yang bshad pa rnam pa gnyis yod de /
analyzed: 'di la yang bshad pa rnam pa gnyis yod de /
translated: Here also there are two explanations.

original: kha cig na re nga ni nam yang ngo bo nyid med pa nyid la mngon par zhen pa ngo bo nyid med pa nyid 'dzin par mi smra ba'i phyir /
analyzed: kha cig na re nga ni nam yang ngo bo nyid med pa nyid la mngon par zhen pa ngo bo nyid med pa nyid 'dzin par mi smra ba'i phyir /
translated: Some say that this teaches that I never say that one should apprehend the very non-entityness that one is attached to,

original: ngas ngo bo nyid dang bcas pa nyid 'dzin pa mi gsung ngo zhes bstan pa yin no zhe'o //
analyzed: ngas ngo bo nyid dang bcas pa nyid 'dzin pa mi gsung ngo zhes bstan pa yin no zhe'o //
translated: because I do not say that one should apprehend that which possesses entityness.

original: kha cig na re nga ni nam yang ngo bo nyid med pa nyid 'dzin par nga mi smra ste /
analyzed: kha cig na re nga ni nam yang ngo bo nyid med pa nyid 'dzin par nga mi smra ste /
translated: Some say that I never say that one should apprehend non-entityness,

original: 'di ltar ngo bo nyid med pa nyid ni ming tshig dang bral pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: 'di ltar ngo bo nyid med pa nyid ni ming tshig dang bral pa'i phyir te /
translated: because non-entityness is free from name and phrase.

original: de'i phyir ngo bo nyid dang bcas pa nyid 'dzin par byed do @75b zhes brjod par mi bya'o zhes bstan pa yin no zhe'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir ngo bo nyid dang bcas pa nyid 'dzin par byed do @75b zhes brjod par mi bya'o zhes bstan pa yin no zhe'o //
translated: Therefore, it is taught that one should not say that it apprehends that which has intrinsic reality.

original: 'on kyang ngo bo nyid med pa nyid yi ge rnams dang bral na nang gi so so rang gis rig pa zhes bya bas ni gnyis pa rjes su mthun pa'i rnam par bshad pas ngo bo nyid med pa ni tshig bral ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: 'on kyang ngo bo nyid med pa nyid yi ge rnams dang bral na nang gi so so rang gis rig pa zhes bya bas ni gnyis pa rjes su mthun pa'i rnam par bshad pas ngo bo nyid med pa ni tshig bral ba'i phyir te /
translated: However, if intrinsic realitylessness is free from syllables, it is called ‚Äúthe inner, intuitive wisdom.‚Äù The second explanation is that intrinsic realitylessness is free from words because it is free from syllables.

original: de'i phyir ngo bo nyid dang bcas pa nyid 'dzin na nang gi so so rang gis rig pa nyid du bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir ngo bo nyid dang bcas pa nyid 'dzin na nang gi so so rang gis rig pa nyid du bstan pa'o //
translated: Therefore, if one apprehends that which has intrinsic reality, it is taught that it is not the inner, intuitive wisdom.

original: 'di ni gong du mdo de nyid las ngas don dam pa ni brjod du med pa yin par bshad la /
analyzed: 'di ni gong du mdo de nyid las ngas don dam pa ni brjod du med pa yin par bshad la /
translated: This is because above, in that very s≈´tra, it says, ‚ÄúI have explained that the ultimate is inexpressible.üîΩSince imagination and analysis operate in the domain of expression, they do not operate in the domain of the ultimate.‚Äù

original: rtog pa dang dpyod pa ni brjod pa'i spyod yul la spyod pas zhes gsungs pa dang / gzhan yang don dam pa ni 'phags pa rnams kyi nang gi so so rang gis rig pa yin par bshad la ;
analyzed: rtog pa dang dpyod pa ni brjod pa'i spyod yul la spyod pas zhes gsungs pa dang / gzhan yang don dam pa ni 'phags pa rnams kyi nang gi so so rang gis rig pa yin par bshad la ;
translated: It also says, ‚ÄúThe ultimate is explained to be the inner, intuitive wisdom of the ƒÅryas.

original: rtog pa dpyod pa'i spyod pa ni so so'i skye bo rnams kyi phan tshun rig par bya ba yin pas zhes gsungs pa nyid do //
analyzed: rtog pa dpyod pa'i spyod pa ni so so'i skye bo rnams kyi phan tshun rig par bya ba yin pas zhes gsungs pa nyid do //
translated: The activity of investigating concepts is for the sake of mutual understanding among ordinary beings.

original: gzhan yang bstan bcos rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las /üîΩgzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' de ni chos bdag med pa'i ye shes la ring du zhugs pa des chos thams cad kyi brjod du med pa'i ngo bo nyid yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rtogs pas dngos po tsam ma ma de bzhin nyid tsam du
analyzed: gzhan yang bstan bcos rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las / gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' de ni chos bdag med pa'i ye shes la ring du zhugs pa des chos thams cad kyi brjod du med pa'i ngo bo nyid yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rtogs pas dngos po tsam ma ma de bzhin nyid tsam du
translated: Moreover, the Bodhisattvabhumi states:

original: 'dzin pa ma gtogs par chos gang la yang rung ste /
analyzed: 'dzin pa ma gtogs par chos gang la yang rung ste /
translated: Moreover, the bodhisattva who has long engaged in the wisdom of the selflessness of phenomena, through that, correctly realizes the inexpressible nature of all phenomena, and apart from apprehending mere things and mere suchness,

original: ji lta bur yang rnam par rtog par mi byed do //üîΩ'on kyang de 'di snyam du 'di ni dngos po tsam mo //
analyzed: ji lta bur yang rnam par rtog par mi byed do // 'on kyang de 'di snyam du 'di ni dngos po tsam mo //
translated: he does not conceive of any phenomenon whatsoever in any way.

original: 'di ni de bzhin nyid tsam mo snyam du yang mi sems par don spyod par byed do zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: 'di ni de bzhin nyid tsam mo snyam du yang mi sems par don spyod par byed do zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: However, he does not think, 'This is mere things' or 'This is mere suchness,' but engages in the meaning.

original: brjod pa dang yi ge spangs pas kyang bstan par mi nus pas zhes bya ba ni gsum pa rgol ba'i lan bstan pa'o //
analyzed: brjod pa dang yi ge spangs pas kyang bstan par mi nus pas zhes bya ba ni gsum pa rgol ba'i lan bstan pa'o //
translated: Since it cannot be shown by abandoning expression and syllables, this is the third, the response to the objection.

original: kha cig 'di skad du gal te de lta na /
analyzed: kha cig 'di skad du gal te de lta na /
translated: Some think, If that is so,

original: ci'i phyir gong du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pas ngo bo nyid med pa nyid yin na 'dzin par byed ces bstan snyam pa la /
analyzed: ci'i phyir gong du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pas ngo bo nyid med pa nyid yin na 'dzin par byed ces bstan snyam pa la /
translated: why was it taught above that if the perfection of wisdom is essenceless, it is apprehended?

original: de'i phyir 'dir brjod pa spangs pas kyang bstan par mi nus pas zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'dir brjod pa spangs pas kyang bstan par mi nus pas zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: Therefore, here it is said, Since it cannot be shown by abandoning expression,

original: 'dis dris pa dang lan ni bstan bcos rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las ji skad bstan pa bzhin du rig par bya ste /
analyzed: 'dis dris pa dang lan ni bstan bcos rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las ji skad bstan pa bzhin du rig par bya ste /
translated: and this question and answer should be understood as taught in the Treatise on the Levels of Yogic Practice.

original: de'i phyir de nyid las gal te chos thams cad brjod du med pa'i ngo bo nyid yin na /
analyzed: de'i phyir de nyid las gal te chos thams cad brjod du med pa'i ngo bo nyid yin na /
translated: Therefore, it says in that very text, If all phenomena are inexpressible,

original: ci'i phyir sbyor bar byed ce na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir sbyor bar byed ce na /
translated: why is it applied?

original: smras pa / 'di ltar brjod pa med na yang /
analyzed: smras pa / 'di ltar brjod pa med na yang /
translated: It is said, In this way, even though inexpressible,üîΩit is applied.

original: brjod du med pa'i chos nyid de gzhan dag la bsnyad pa dang / thos par byed kyang mi nus la /
analyzed: brjod du med pa'i chos nyid de gzhan dag la bsnyad pa dang / thos par byed kyang mi nus la /
translated: It is impossible to explain to others and to listen to that inexpressible reality.

original: tshig dang thos pa med na yang brjod du med pa'i ngo bo nyid de shes par mi nus so //üîΩde bas na thos pa @76a * //
analyzed: tshig dang thos pa med na yang brjod du med pa'i ngo bo nyid de shes par mi nus so // de bas na thos pa @76a * //
translated: And even if words and listening do not exist, it is impossible to understand that inexpressible reality.üîΩTherefore, in order to listen and to understand, one should also apply expressions.

original: dang ; shes par bya ba'i phyir brjod pa yang sbyor bar byed do zhes 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: dang ; shes par bya ba'i phyir brjod pa yang sbyor bar byed do zhes 'byung ba yin no //
translated: Moreover, that same text says:

original: gzhan yang de nyid las chos thams cad kyang brjod du med pa'i bdag nyid dang / spros pa chad pa dang / tshig gi spyod yul las 'das pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pas de dag ni brjod pa la brten nas gzung bar bya ba dang /
analyzed: gzhan yang de nyid las chos thams cad kyang brjod du med pa'i bdag nyid dang / spros pa chad pa dang / tshig gi spyod yul las 'das pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pas de dag ni brjod pa la brten nas gzung bar bya ba dang /
translated: Since all phenomena have an inexpressible nature, are free from mental proliferation, and are essentially beyond the domain of words, they are to be grasped in dependence on expressions,üîΩto be apprehended,

original: blta bar bya ba dang / rtogs par bya ba yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: blta bar bya ba dang / rtogs par bya ba yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: to be seen, and to be realized.

original: de lta bas na zab mo mthong bar dka' ba yin par rig par bya'o zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de lta bas na zab mo mthong bar dka' ba yin par rig par bya'o zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: Therefore, it should be understood that the profound is difficult to see.

original: de'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni chos rnams kyi ngo bo nyid med pa nyid 'dzin par byed do zhes brjod do zhes bya ba ni lnga pa mjug bsdu ba ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni chos rnams kyi ngo bo nyid med pa nyid 'dzin par byed do zhes brjod do zhes bya ba ni lnga pa mjug bsdu ba ste /
translated: This is the fifth section, the conclusion.

original: brda phrad par zad do //
analyzed: brda phrad par zad do //
translated: The meaning is clear.

original: byang chub sems dpa' spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug gis yang bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug gis yang bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: The bodhisattva Avalokitesvara said to the Lord:

original: bcom ldan 'das bcom ldan 'das kyis ji skad du pha rol tu phyin pa dang nye ba'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / pha rol tu phyin pa chen po'o zhes gang gsungs pa de la pha rol tu phyin pa ni gang lags /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das bcom ldan 'das kyis ji skad du pha rol tu phyin pa dang nye ba'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / pha rol tu phyin pa chen po'o zhes gang gsungs pa de la pha rol tu phyin pa ni gang lags /
translated: Lord, as for what the Lord has said, 'the perfection, the proximate perfection, and the great perfection,' what is the perfection?

original: nye ba'i pha rol tu phyin pa ni gang lags /
analyzed: nye ba'i pha rol tu phyin pa ni gang lags /
translated: What is the proximate perfection?üîΩWhat is the great perfection?'

original: pha rol tu phyin pa chen po ni gang lags zhes bya ba 'di man chad ni bco brgyad pa pha rol tu phyin pa'i rnam pa bstan pa'i sgo zhes bya ba ston to //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa chen po ni gang lags zhes bya ba 'di man chad ni bco brgyad pa pha rol tu phyin pa'i rnam pa bstan pa'i sgo zhes bya ba ston to //
translated: This is the eighteenth chapter, on the teaching of the door of the varieties of perfections.

original: 'di yang zhu ba gsol pa dang / lan gsungs pas bstan te /
analyzed: 'di yang zhu ba gsol pa dang / lan gsungs pas bstan te /
translated: This is also shown by the request and the answer.

original: 'di ni zhu ba gsol ba nyid do //
analyzed: 'di ni zhu ba gsol ba nyid do //
translated: This is the request itself.

original: mdo'i zhu tshig 'di yang rnam pa gnyis su dbye ste /
analyzed: mdo'i zhu tshig 'di yang rnam pa gnyis su dbye ste /

analyzed: mtshan nyid kyi rjes su rab tu dbye ba'i phyir gnas pa dag gis gsum po dag spong ngo zhes bshad de /

analyzed: 'di ltar lpags shun la yod pa lta bu'i gnas ngan len ni sa dang po pas spong ngo //

analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi sa las ni rkang la yod pa lta bu spong bas so //
translated: And the buddha ground eliminates those that are like those in the bones.üîΩSince the meaning of the three, such as the perfect destruction of the companions, is not clearly distinguished, if the first ground eliminates the negative tendencies that are like those on the skin, then the perfect destruction of the companions and the meaning of the weakness of the body will be clearly distinguished later.

original: gnyis pa ni sa brgyad pa la spri la yod pa lta bu'i gnas ngan len spangs pas shin tu phra ba'i don gsal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir spri la yod pa lta bu spangs pa'i phyir ni gsum pa de rab tu dbye ba yin no zhes bya ba gsungsüîΩpa yin no //

analyzed: rkang la yod pa lta bu'i gnas ngan len spang ba gang yin pa de ni ngas bag la nyal thams cad gtan du spangs pa'i gnas skabs sangs rgyas kyi sa yin par yongs su bstan to zhes bya bas ni gnyis pa rkang la yod pa lta bu spang ba nyid du bstan cing /
translated: The fault of the foot is the abandonment of the fault of the foot, which I have taught to be the stage of buddhahood, the state of abandoning all latent states forever.üîΩThis teaches the second, the abandonment of the fault of the foot.

original: logs shig tu rnam par phye ste rnam par ma bstan to //
analyzed: logs shig tu rnam par phye ste rnam par ma bstan to //
translated: It is not taught separately as a distinct abandonment.

original: de ni 'di skad du shes bya'i sgrib pa las rkang la yod ba lta bu'i gnas ngan len ni shin tu phra ba'i phyir rnam par grol ba'i lam gyi tshe gdod spong bas zad par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ni 'di skad du shes bya'i sgrib pa las rkang la yod ba lta bu'i gnas ngan len ni shin tu phra ba'i phyir rnam par grol ba'i lam gyi tshe gdod spong bas zad par 'gyur te /
translated: That is to say, the negative reflex action which is like a foot in the obstruction of the knowable is extremely subtle, and so is eliminated by the path of liberation.

original: gnas skabs 'di ni bag la nyal rnam pa gsum gyi gnas ngan len dang bral ba'i don logs shig tu rnam par phye nas mi ston gyi /
analyzed: gnas skabs 'di ni bag la nyal rnam pa gsum gyi gnas ngan len dang bral ba'i don logs shig tu rnam par phye nas mi ston gyi /
translated: This state is not taught as a separate meaning of being free from the negative reflex action of the three latent prospers.

original: spyir sangs rgyas kyi gnas pa la @84b bag la nyal rnam pa gsum gyi sa bon gtan du spong ba rab tu ston to zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: spyir sangs rgyas kyi gnas pa la @84b bag la nyal rnam pa gsum gyi sa bon gtan du spong ba rab tu ston to zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: In general, it is taught that the state of Buddhahood is the complete elimination of the seeds of the three latent prospers.

original: mtshams rnam par dgrol ba'i mdo las ni /
analyzed: mtshams rnam par dgrol ba'i mdo las ni /
translated: In the Sutra Unravelling the Intended Meaning,üîΩit says:

original: skyon rnam pa du zhig spangs pas nyon mongs pa de dag spangs pa zhes bgyi lags /
analyzed: skyon rnam pa du zhig spangs pas nyon mongs pa de dag spangs pa zhes bgyi lags /
translated: ‚ÄúWhat are the faults that are eliminated when those afflictions are eliminated?‚Äù

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug la bka' stsal ba /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug la bka' stsal ba /
translated: The Bhagavan replied to Avalokitesvara:

analyzed: rnam pa gsum gyis te dang po ni lpags shun la yod pa lta bu'i skyon spangs pa'o //

original: gnyis pa ni spri la yod pa lta bu'i skyon spangs pa'o //
analyzed: gnyis pa ni spri la yod pa lta bu'i skyon spangs pa'o //
translated: The second is the abandonment of the fault that is like the one in the flesh.

original: gsum pa ni rkang la yod pa lta bu'i skyon spangs pa'o //
analyzed: gsum pa ni rkang la yod pa lta bu'i skyon spangs pa'o //
translated: The third is the abandonment of the fault that is like the one in the bone.

original: nyon mongs pa thams cad spangs pa gang yin pa de ni sangs rgyas kyi sa kho na la bskal pa gsum du bstan to zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa thams cad spangs pa gang yin pa de ni sangs rgyas kyi sa kho na la bskal pa gsum du bstan to zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: The abandonment of all the defilements is taught in the Buddha stage alone, in three eons.üîΩIn the Sutra Unravelling the Intended Meaning, it says:

original: dgongs pa zab mo rnam par dgrol ba'i mdo las ni rkang la yod pa lta bu rnam pa du zhig spangs pas nyon mongs pa spangs pa zhes bgyi lags /
analyzed: dgongs pa zab mo rnam par dgrol ba'i mdo las ni rkang la yod pa lta bu rnam pa du zhig spangs pas nyon mongs pa spangs pa zhes bgyi lags /
translated: How many types of faults that are like the ones in the bone are abandoned by the abandonment of the defilements?

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal ba /üîΩrkang la yod pa lta bu rnam pa gnyis spangs pas nyon mongs pa rnams spong bar 'gyur te ;
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal ba / rkang la yod pa lta bu rnam pa gnyis spangs pas nyon mongs pa rnams spong bar 'gyur te ;
translated: The Bhagavan replied:üîΩThe defilements are abandoned by abandoning two types of faults that are like the ones in the bone.

original: spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug dang po lpags shun la yod pa lta bu'i sgrib pa spangs pas ni skyon dang po dang bral bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug dang po lpags shun la yod pa lta bu'i sgrib pa spangs pas ni skyon dang po dang bral bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Avalokitdvara, by abandoning the obscurations that are like the ones in the outer skin, one is freed from the first fault.

original: de'i 'og tu spri la yod pa lta bu'i sgrib pa spangs pas ni skyon gnyis pa dang bral bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu spri la yod pa lta bu'i sgrib pa spangs pas ni skyon gnyis pa dang bral bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Then, by abandoning the obscurations that are like fat, one becomes free from the second fault.
